subject: AI & Agents
title: The Turing Test
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Turing Test.

hook.text: If you chat with a machine and can't tell it's not human, is it intelligent?

buildup.text: In 1950, Turing proposed the 'Imitation Game' â€” a test based on conversation, not consciousness.

discovery.text: A human judge chats with a hidden human and a hidden machine. If fooled, the machine passes.

twist.text: No machine truly passed for decades. Then chatbots got so good the test seemed too easy.

climax.text: Critics say the test measures deception, not intelligence. The debate rages on.

punchline.text: Turing didn't define intelligence. He dodged the question brilliantly.

quiz.question: What does the Turing Test evaluate?
options: Whether a machine can fool a human in conversation
How fast a computer processes data
